qas.question: What regnal name did Albert adopt?
What title did Albert give Edward?

answers.text: His Royal Highness The Duke of Windsor

qas.question: What did Albert bestow onto his wife on his 41st birthday?
Which two residences did Albert buy from Edward?
What birthday did George IV's queen consort have before being invested with the Order of the Garter?
Who did Edward succeed as king?
What royal residence did George VI own?
In what city is Sandringham House?

context: Albert assumed the regnal name "<a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>George VI<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>" to emphasise continuity with his father and restore confidence in the monarchy. The beginning of George VI's reign was taken up by questions surrounding his predecessor and brother, whose titles, style and position were uncertain. He had been introduced as "His Royal Highness Prince Edward" for the abdication broadcast, but George VI felt that by abdicating and renouncing the succession Edward had lost the right to bear royal titles, including "Royal Highness". In settling the issue, George's first act as king was to confer upon his brother the title and style "<a1_0>His Royal Highness The Duke of <b8_0>Windsor<b8_0/><a1_0/>", but the Letters Patent creating the dukedom prevented any wife or children from bearing royal styles. George VI was also forced to buy from Edward the royal residences of <a3_0><b7_0>Balmoral Castle<b7_0/> and Sandringham House<a3_0/>, as these were private properties and did not pass to George VI automatically. Three days after his accession, on his <b4_0>41st birthday<b4_0/>, he invested his wife, the new queen consort, with <a2_0>the Order of the Garter<a2_0/>.
